teaser: The tentative deal with Iran to limit its nuclear activities would also lead to lifted sanctions. Iran has vast reserves of natural gas, zinc, iron and copper, not to mention 80 million consumers and a large, sophisticated middle class. The country could potentially become the largest, most important economy in the Middle East. Plus, tomorrow U.S. Senator Rand Paul is expected to make official what's been widely speculated for months: he's running for president. When hopefuls announce can make a big difference, since candidates can't coordinate with super PACs, but those testing the water can, like Jeb Bush or Hillary Clinton. Also, farmers have produced record corn crops the past two years, driving down their own prices by 20 percent. The record number came with converting millions of acres of grassland into marginal farmland — with a carbon footprint equal to 34 coal-powered generating plants.
